algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using a min-heap to always process the strain that finishes earliest after splitting.
Simulate WBC splitting and task assignment to minimize total time.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum time to eliminate all bacterial strains using WBCs that can split.
problem_summary_technical: Use a min-heap to manage WBCs and bacterial strains, greedily assigning tasks and simulating splits to minimize completion time.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as assigning tasks (eliminating strains) to workers (WBCs) with a splitting cost.
A greedy strategy works: always split the WBC that will finish its current task earliest.
A min-heap is ideal for efficiently retrieving the WBC that finishes earliest.
